verses.verse: (Israel’s Deliverance Assured) (Ex 3.19, 20; 7.4, 5; 12.31, 33, 39) Then the LORD said to Moses, “Now you shall see what I will do to Pharaoh: indeed, by a mighty hand he will let them go; by a mighty hand he will drive them out of his land.”
God also spoke to Moses and said to him, “I am the LORD.

(Ps 68.4; 83.18; Isa 52.6; Jer 16.21; Ezek 37.6, 13) I appeared to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob as God Almighty, (Traditional rendering of Heb El Shaddai) but by my name ‘The LORD’ (Heb YHWH; see note at 3.15) I did not make myself known to them.
(Gen 15.18; 28.4) I also established my covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land in which they resided as aliens.
(Ex 2.24) I have also heard the groaning of the Israelites whom the Egyptians have enslaved, and I have remembered my covenant.

(Deut 26.8) Say therefore to the Israelites: I am the LORD, and I will free you from the burdens of the Egyptians and deliver you from slavery to them. I will redeem you with an outstretched arm and with great acts of judgment.
(Ex 16.12; Deut 4.20; 26.8; Ps 81.6; Isa 41.20) I will take you as my people, and I will be your God. You shall know that I am the LORD your God, who has freed you from the burdens of the Egyptians.
(Gen 15.18) I will bring you into the land that I swore to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; I will give it to you for a possession. I am the LORD.”
Moses told this to the Israelites, but they would not listen to Moses, because of their broken spirit and their cruel slavery.
Then the LORD spoke to Moses,
“Go and tell Pharaoh king of Egypt to let the Israelites go out of his land.”
But Moses spoke to the LORD, “The Israelites have not listened to me; why should Pharaoh listen to me, poor speaker that I am?” (Heb me? I am uncircumcised of lips)
Thus the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron and gave them orders regarding the Israelites and Pharaoh king of Egypt, to free the Israelites from the land of Egypt.

(The Genealogy of Moses and Aaron) (Gen 46.9; Num 26.5-11) The following are the heads of their ancestral houses: the sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel: Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi; these are the families of Reuben.
(Gen 46.10; 1 Chr 4.24) The sons of Simeon: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Shaul, the son of a Canaanite woman; these are the families of Simeon.
(Gen 46.11; Num 3.17) The following are the names of the sons of Levi according to their genealogies: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari, and the length of Levi’s life was one hundred thirty-seven years.
(1 Chr 6.17) The sons of Gershon: Libni and Shimei, by their families.
(1 Chr 6.2, 18) The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, and the length of Kohath’s life was one hundred thirty-three years.
(1 Chr 6.19) The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their genealogies.
(Ex 2.1, 2; Num 26.59) Amram married Jochebed his aunt, and she bore him Aaron and Moses, and the length of Amram’s life was one hundred thirty-seven years.
(Num 16.1; 1 Chr 6.37, 38) The sons of Izhar: Korah, Nepheg, and Zichri.
(Lev 10.4; Num 3.30) The sons of Uzziel: Mishael, Elzaphan, and Sithri.
Aaron married Elisheba, daughter of Amminadab and sister of Nahshon, and she bore him Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
(Num 26.11) The sons of Korah: Assir, Elkanah, and Abiasaph; these are the families of the Korahites.

(Num 25.7-11; Josh 24.33; Ps 106.30) Aaron’s son Eleazar married one of the daughters of Putiel, and she bore him Phinehas. These are the heads of the ancestral houses of the Levites by their families.
It was this same Aaron and Moses to whom the LORD said, “Bring the Israelites out of the land of Egypt, company by company.”
It was they who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt to bring the Israelites out of Egypt, the same Moses and Aaron.
(Moses and Aaron Obey God’s Commands) On the day when the LORD spoke to Moses in the land of Egypt,
(v 11|EXO 6:11; Ex 7.2) the LORD said to Moses, “I am the LORD; tell Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I am speaking to you.”
(v 12|EXO 6:12; Ex 4.10) But Moses said to the LORD, “Since I am a poor speaker, (Heb am uncircumcised of lips) why should Pharaoh listen to me?”
